pr_title: Add some PostgreSQL compatibility features mentioned in issue #2450

timeline.bodyText: All PostgreSQL-specific logic here should be restricted to PostgreSQL compatibility mode.
timeline.author: katzyn

timeline.bodyText: Please, remove this commented out code.
timeline.author: katzyn

timeline.bodyText: PostgreSQL treats only lowercase $user in the special way.
timeline.author: katzyn

timeline.bodyText:
I think you need to check for exact name here too. The real PostgreSQL does not process its own pg_catalog before specified schemas only when pg_catalog is specified in the proper case in the search path.
pgCatalog.equals(s)
timeline.author: katzyn

replies.bodyText:
I tested on real PG and a schema with upper-case PG_CATALOG can be created, which can miss really lower-case pg_catalog if use case-insensitive check.
I think database.sysIdentifier("$USER") and database.sysIdentifier("PG_CATALOG") might work well in this special senario.
replies.author: auntyellow

replies.bodyText:
Of course in can be created in both PostgreSQL and H2. These databases are case-sensitive. (Case sensitivity of H2 is actually configurable, but this feature should not be used in PostgreSQL compatibility mode.) database.sysIdentifier("PG_CATALOG") should be fine.
But $user should be simply hardcoded in lower case, it's not a schema name and the real PostgreSQL does not treat it in special way in any other case.
replies.author: katzyn

replies.bodyText: Fixed. And, database.sysIdentifier("$USER") cannot pass test (with -ea VM option) :-P
replies.author: auntyellow
